alert.note: Alert for Lee; Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lee and northeastern Phillips Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 452 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rondo, or 7 miles northeast of Marvell, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St Francis National Park, Helena-West Helena, Lexa, Rondo, Lagrange, Poplar Grove, Huma, Big Creek Corner, Quarles, Barton, Wycamp, Latour, Kindall, Phillips Bayou, Turkey Scratch, Vineyard, Spring Creek, Scott Valley, Cypress Corner and Delta Heritage Trails State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
